text: The Lauderdale County Courthouse is a PWA Moderne-style courthouse built in 1936. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The two- story-plus-basement building's most prominent feature is its "vertical stepped massing". Its central block is in plan, and tall. It has wings which are each in plan and tall. It was designed by Nashville architects Marr and Holman and was built by R. M. Condra Contractors. It was the first Public Works Administration-funded courthouse completed in Tennessee. title: Lauderdale County Courthouse (Tennessee)
